<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_set_connection_value:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_set_connection_value (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                          enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                          const char *key,
                          const char *value)
{
  return MHD_set_connection_value_n_nocheck_ (connection,
                                              kind,
                                              key,
                                              NULL != key
                                              ? strlen (key)
                                              : 0,
                                              value,
                                              NULL != value
                                              ? strlen (value)
                                              : 0);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
MHD_set_connection_value_n_nocheck_ (connection,
                                              kind,
                                              key,
                                              NULL != key
                                              ? strlen (key)
                                              : 0,
                                              value,
                                              NULL != value
                                              ? strlen (value)
                                              : 0)
explanation: The function body contains no direct call to itself, so there is no direct recursion in this fragment. The only function calls other than the callee are to standard library strlen(), which cannot cause recursion back into this function. The linkage specifier/macro (_MHD_EXTERN), parameter list, and conditional operators are unrelated to Rule 17.2. The only potential for indirect recursion is via the called function named in the returned call; to determine compliance with Rule 17.2 that callee (and any functions it calls) must be inspected. No other fragments in this code excerpt can introduce direct or indirect self-calls to MHD_set_connection_value.
